intro: Hibbertia fractiflexa subsp. fractiflexa, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces bright yellow flowers with prominent, recurved petals, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open forests and heathlands. Hibbertia fractiflexa subsp. fractiflexa is a relatively small shrub, generally reaching heights of up to 1 meter.
